With a host of both multiplayer and single player modes included, players can enjoy Crash Commando either on or offline.

Source: The Publisher Website.

124530.name: Bomberman Ultra
124530.description:
User Summary:

Bomberman Ultra follows the same mechanics of previous games. The major noticeable difference in this game is the possibility of change the outfit of each player. The game supports multiplayer game for up to 8 players.

The game also supports PSN Trophies. You can find below the list of Bomberman Ultra trophies:

Paint the town red!
Win a Zombie match in Local Play against 2+ CPU players.

The Name's Bomb, Dangerous Bomb
Take out 3 CPU players at once in a Local game.

Exterminator
Win 15 Local matches against 3+ CPU players.

Totally Bombed!
Win a Local match against 3+ CPU players after being in a Super Revenge Cart.

Completely Unstoppable!
Remain undefeated for five consecutive 4+ player Online Multiplayer games.

You die so good!
Score 25 Frags in an Online Multiplayer Zombie Match.

The Bomb!
Win 30 Online Multiplayer games.

Joy of Painting with Bomberman
Claim 130 or more tiles in a Local Zombie match against 3+ CPU players.

The Good, The Bad and The Bombed
With the full cowboy outfit, Frag another cowboy in an Online Multiplayer match.

Girl Power!
With a full female outfit, win an Online Multiplayer 4+ player girl only match.

EXTREME MAKEOVER!
Collect 60 Costume Balls.

124531.name: Pixeljunk Racers
124531.description:
User Summary:

PixelJunk Racers is party game, based on racing. The player controls a racing car in a track with separated lanes. The playing screen depicts the whole track and the player can accelerate and change the lane to avoid collisions.

It supports local multiplayer games for up to 7 players.

124532.name: Arkedo Series 001: JUMP!
124532.description:
User Summary

JUMP! is an old-school side-scrolling platformer. The player needs to avoid enemies, collect coins and defuse bombs. The game has a very pleasant retro look, homaging games from the 1980's.

124533.name: Pizza Vs. Skeletons
124533.description:
Pizza Vs. Skeletons is a big, ridiculous, 2D platform game designed from the ground up for iOS. You control a 25 foot tall pizza as it battles a horde of undead rivals on land, sea, and in outer space. Pizza Vs. Skeletons was Apple's iPhone Game of the Week on February 16, 2012.

Features:
- 110 levels loaded with variety
- 3 distinct challenges in each level
- Dozens of types of enemies
- Huge bosses
- 11 vastly different worlds
- Customize your pizza in a quarter million ways.
- Universal build: Buy once, play on all your iOS 5 devices.

Source: The Developer Website.

124534.name: Armis
124534.description:
Armis is a two player high-strategy board game, your objective is to capture the opponent's flag. Success is achieved by planning, implementing, and assessing various strategies and tactics given specific rules, resources, and environments.

Armis rules are detailed in the Player’s Handbook; the game has three environments: land, air, and sea; and the 17 resources are: Flag, President, Vice President, Army, Aircraft Carrier, Submarine, Jet, Helicopter, Marines, Coast Guard, Reserve, Diplomat, Religion, Child, Mover, Media, and Nuke.

Given the above, players instinctively and continuously formulate offensive and defensive situations until a winner emerges.

Armis is great exercise for the mind, and the brain.

124535.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 185 - Mar 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
124535.description:
"Dancin' with the Devil"

Cover by George Vrbanic

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

124536.name: The Hundred Books (Issue 1 - Jan 1999)
124536.description: The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

124537.name: Handbuch für Spielleiter
124537.description:
From the back of the book:

Wie groß sollte eine Spielergruppe sein? Wodurch wird Rollenspielleitung noch aufregender und spannender? Wird das Spiel erfolgreicher, wenn es auf politische Intriegen abzielt, oder sollte es beim einfachen Verlies-Erkunden bleiben? Wie retten sich die Charaktere haarschaft aus tötlicher Gefahr, ohne dass es vorhergeplant wirkt? Wodurch wird Spannung aufrechterhalten und sogar gesteigert?
Wenn Sie sich jemals eine dieser oder ähnliche Fragen gestellt haben, gibt Ihnen dieses Buch die passenden Antworten.
Dieser Ratgeber gibt Hinweise dazu, wie Sie als Spielleiter ROLEMASTER auf Ihre eigenen, individuellen Spielbedürfnisse abstimmen und somit das gesamte Potential des Regelwerks ausschöpfen können. Das Handbuch für Spielleiter stellt Ihnen eine Fülle von Informationen, Ratschlägen und Techniken vor, die Sie für spannende und unterhaltsame Spielleitungen benötigen - und das grundsätzlich übergreifend für jedes Fantasy-Rollenspiel-System. Die hier vorgestellten Themenbereiche sind für jeden Spielleiter bzw. seine erfolgreiche Fantasy-Rollenspielleitung unverzichtbar: Hier finden Sie Anregungen, Tipps, Tricks und Diskussionen über Gruppendynamik, Spielermotivation, glaubhaftes Präsentieren, Weltendesign, Völkererstellung, Kampagnenentwicklung, Spielzusammenhänge, Abenteuerhintergründe und vieles mehr.
Entdecken Sie im Handbuch für Spielleiter die Geheimnisse guter Spielleitung wahrhaft aufregender und unvergesslicher Kampangen...

Translation:
How big should a group of players be? How does game mastering become even more exciting and thrilling? Is the game successful if it focuses on political intrigues, or should it remain in the dungeon-exploring? How to save the group from deadly danger without it seems planned in advance? How is tension maintained and even increased?
If you have ever wondered about any of these or similar questions, this book gives you the right answers.
This guide provides information about how to match as a game master ROLEMASTER on your own individual playing needs and thus exploit the full potential of the rules. The manual for GM introduces a wealth of information, advice and techniques you need for exciting and entertaining game lines - and that basically for every fantasy role-playing game system. The presented topics are for each game master or his successful fantasy role-playing game indispensable: Here you can find ideas, tips, tricks and discussions on group dynamics, player motivation, credible presentation, world design, character creation, campaign development, game links, adventure backgrounds and much more.
Discover in the Handbuch für Spielleiter the secrets of good game management of a truly exciting and unforgettable campaign ...

124538.name: Area of Darkness
124538.description:
A dynamic and exciting first-person shooter, which is set in Chernozerske. In this city an extraordinary situation has arised following a military project where a mutagenic infected strain of a virus has started to spread, turning citizens into warriors.

The game has two full storylines with an individual style of gameplay in each one of them. In one you play the role of Andrei Yegorov, a fighter from spec. ops. You will take part in the operation to investigatethe causes of the disaster in the city and try save it. In the other you play as Gorin, a test object in whom things has been grown in a secret laboratory in the framework of the the military project named "Creator"

Source: The Developer Website.

124539.name: Unser Sandmännchen: Komm mit ins Traumland
124539.description:
In this game about sandman, players visit foreign countries with him: India, Hawaii or Mexico etc.
All tiles are shuffled and placed face down on the table. In his turn player turns up a tile. If the background is dark, he can either take all face-up tiles from the table and ends his turn or he can turns up another tile, but when the sandman appears on the tile the next player starts his turn. The upturned tiles stay in place for next players. When all sandmen are turned up, the player with the most travel tiles wins.

124540.name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms XII
124540.description:
User Summary

Romance of the Three Kingdoms XII, also known as Sangokushi 12 (三國志12), is the 12th installment in Koei's famous Romance of the Three Kingdoms series.

124541.description:
Questions about dogs - puppies, care, breeds, diseases, dog sports, origin, education, dog owners, breeding, and dog foods.

6 question on card with 3 answer choises for each question, the question is determined rolling the dice. Depending on the version you have to collect a small plate of each color or get rid of the flakes.
124541.name: Das Hunde Quiz

124542.name: Das Quiz des Jahres 2003
124542.description:
Trivia game about events of this year. Several variants can be played.
There are 5 questions on the card. In his turn player rolls the dice and choose aks the question or if "6" is rolled he chooses question randomly. Who answers correctly gets the card.

Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

124543.description:
Objective:
be the first climbing up victory points list to the top
- moving/acting by turn -

each player throws the die, moving round the board, drafting cards (some multiple choice), finding questions for answers out the 60's - 90's, gaining victory points.

Contentd:

1 game board with two game plans
55 quiz cards with 6600 questions and answers
4 Betting Chips
36 Number of chips
1 dice
4 game characters
1 set of instructions
124543.name: Das Ü-30 Quiz

124545.description:
In Town Center, players build a city – in particular, the town center. They add cubes on their personal board and try to arrange them as best as possible in order to score the most victory points. Each cube represents a different type of module. Flats, shops, offices, generators, lifts, car parks, town hall can be built and stacked during the course of the game. Each module generates influence on adjacent land and on cubes directly below or above.

Each round, players will gain two cubes of different colors through a non-random mechanism, build them on their game board, then eventually stack them in order to make towers according to the building rules. If the players have done their job well, some modules will be able to evolve, becoming bigger in three dimensions. The last phase is an income phase in which players gain money from the shops and parking lots if they are supplied with electricity.

The bigger and higher your city is, the more victory points players will have at the end of the game, which lasts ten rounds – but do not forget to provide electricity to all your flats, shops, and lifts to make them more efficient.

Town Center is the second title in designer Alban Viard's "Small City" trilogy, Card City being the first.
124545.name: Town Center
boardgameexpansion: Town Center: Lower Manhattan / Paris La Cité – St. Louis
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 72 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 1

124547.name: Zum Glück gibt's Freunde
124547.description: The friends Franz von Hahn, Johnny Mauser and Waldemar see each other through a lot of adventures. In Variant 1 a players rolls the die to determine the number of tries he has to find a certain tile, depending on what he turns up the turn stone or the player’s stone is moved. The first player to reach the finish wins. In variant 2 correct tiles are placed on the board, all players win together when all tiles are on the board and the turn stone is not over the finish. In Variant 3 the players piece is moved, then tiles are searched and depending on the result the player’s piece or the turn stone is moved. The first player to reach the finish wins the game.

124548.description:
Game description from the publisher:

You're one of the Great Old Ones – beings of ancient and eldritch power. Cosmic forces have held you at bay for untold aeons, but at last the stars are right and your maniacal cult has called you to this benighted place. Once you regain your full powers, you will unleash your Doom upon the world!

There's only one problem: You're not alone. The other Great Old Ones are here as well, and your rivals are determined to steal your cultists and snatch victory from your flabby claws! It's a race to the ultimate finish as you crush houses, smash holes in reality, and fight to call down The Doom That Came To Atlantic City!

You and your fellow players are Great Old Ones competing to be the first to destroy the world. There are two ways to achieve this:


Any Great Old One can win by obtaining six gates, at which point the game instantly ends. You have only five gate markers because if you open a sixth gate, you win!



At the start of the game, each Great Old One receives a Doom card providing a shortcut to victory. If you land on one of your gates and meet the preconditions, you may attempt the action listed on your Doom. If you succeed, you win!
124548.name: The Doom That Came To Atlantic City

124549.name: The Hundred Books (Issue 2 - Apr 1999)
124549.description: The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

124550.name: RTL Boxen
124550.description:
Players are managers of one or more boxers by training and sending them a ring, winning advertising contracts and negotiating the profit exchanges.
There is also possible to bet to boxers You think to win.

The ranking is determined by dice the fighting with the boxing cards and boxing dice.

The game is played over an entire season, the victory decide the highest revenue.

124551.name: Das verzauberte Märchenbuch
124551.description:
The player must find the missing pages of the storybook in the enchanted forest again.
In his turn player rolls and moves and looks at the plate next to the target field. If it shows desired fairy tale, You get the card and a new card is revealed. If all the fairy tales have found, the player with the most cards wins.

124552.name: Galgun
124552.description:
Story

Tenzou, the protagonist is a student who is accidentally shot by an apprentice angel Patoko, with a Cupid Arrow. The blessing from the arrow makes Tenzou irresistible to the opposite sex, transforming him into the most popular boy in school for one day.

The catch is if Tenzou is unable to find his true love before the effects of the Cupid Arrow wear off, he’ll be destined for a life of loneliness.

Originally only for the Xbox 360, a PS3 port with additional characters and PlayStation Move support has been released on February 23, 2012.

Gameplay

Gal Gun plays is basically a rail shooter, with the player walking through the school - As girl after girl runs towards the player trying to profess their love via hand-written notes or screams. Armed with "pheromone shots", the player keep the girls at bay by shooting and dropping them to the floor in dizzy ecstasy - All the while trying to cultivate a romance with one of the four main female leads.

The shooting is broken up by "action events" - Similar to that of a boss battle as well as a doki doki mode ("anxious" or "excited" in English) where the player has the option to zoom in and stare at one particular girl he fancied.

The developer has also added a panic button that switches the action for a retro-looking game, with authentic animations and sounds. This is referred to as a Mama kita gamen or "Mom arrived screen,".

Source: Wikipedia, "Gal*Gun", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

124553.name: Welt der Wunder
124553.description: Players are collecting interesting themes for the next show in the series, there are 6 categories - Space, Dinosaurs, Technology, Underwater, Nature and Man. On the board theme- and action cards are randomly distributed. In his turn a player must answer a question from one of the 6 categories. If his answer is correct, he may move up to three spaces, if his answer is wrong, he moves one space. If his move ends on a space with a card, the player may turn the card over - if he can use it for one of his themes, he can take it. If it is an action card, he can use it immediately or later in the game. The player who gathers his 4 themes for the show first, wins the game..

124554.name: Spotto
124554.description:
Promotional game from BP, so naturally it is a game to play in a car. Each player gets a sheet of things to look out for and the one who has seen the most during the journey, wins.

On the reverse of the player sheets there are some picture puzzles, a maze and, bizarrely, a guide to giving mouth-to-mouth resuscitation.

124555.name: Kung-Fu High Impact
124555.description:
Are you ready to kick some serious ass?! Step inside the coolest, most impressive and magnificently entertaining adventure known to man. With the power of Kinect, Kung-Fu High Impact scans you inside a world of pulp action comics to kick, punch and shoot lightning from your hands like never before. Literally become a super-powered kung-fu hero and experience the intense action of the coolest full-body motion fighting game to date!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgamecompilation: Super Dungeon Explore: Caverns of Roxor
124556.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Grow your strategy into is full potential with additional minions and denizens to fill our your dungeon.

Box text:

With iron hard claws, poorly timed explosions, and wits as dim as the caves they call home, the Rock Top Gangs are a great asset in expanding any dungeon lords under-empire.

This expansion includes:
13 fully assembled Soda Pop Miniatures, Monster's Game Cards, 6 Turtle Shell Markers and an unique Rock Top Gang Treasure Card
124556.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Rock Top Gang

boardgamecompilation: Super Dungeon Explore: Caverns of Roxor
124558.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Grow your strategy to its full potential with additional denizens to fill out your dungeon.

Box text:

The Fireflows breed an especially cantankerous and mean spirited menagerie of monsters. When living flame and brimstone stalk the dungeon, it is the careless hero that does not take heed, less they become a greasy reminder to the next passer by.

This expansion includes:
13 fully assembled Soda Pop miniatures, Monster game cards and an unique Fireflow Denizens Treasure Card.
124558.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Fireflow Denizens

124559.name: Game of Naval War
124559.description:
Two opposing fleets of 5 ships each, one fleet being blue and the other red vie to see which fleet can capture all the ships of the other.
A die roll determines which fleet begins in Cadiz and which fleet begins in the Tortugas.
Players use a spinner to determine how far to move. That movement can be in any direction over GOLD roads or over the roads of his/her color. The winner is the player having any ships left, after all of the ships of the enemy have been captured.
Gold roads can be used by any player. Red cannot use Blue roads and vice versa. Any ship that arrives at the enemy headquarters captures all of the ships there. If there are no ships there the player gets back one of his own ships or the first ship subsequently captured afterwards. That ship begins again in his home area. To capture a ship it must be landed on by exact count. There are mines that might be landed on. These destroy ships which are permanently removed from the game

From NY Historical Museum:
"The Game of Naval War" paper covered cardboard box top with a chromolithographed image of a naval battle with a gun deck in the foreground with crew members dying and ships in the background sinking and burning and two American ships coming to the rescue; cover inscribed, "THE/ GAME/ OF/ NAVAL WAR/ COPYRIGHT 1898/ McLOUGHLIN BROS/ NEW YORK/ COPYRIGHT 1898 BY F. D. MAHER."

Overall: 13 x 21 1/2 in. ( 33 x 54.6 cm )

124560.name: Game of Discovering the North Pole
124560.description:
This McLoughlin Brothers game comes from 1909.

The Object of the game is to see which player can first reach the North Pole and get home safely.

Each player using his/her colored marker must use that colored space indicator and must obey any directions on places he lands on.

Eventually players will reach a gold spot where all colored roads meet, this does not have to be by exact count. Once reaching that space players may use squares for the remainder of their attempt once again following any directions with an objective of landing on the square marked "North Pole"

Once there, any route can be used to return. If you land on another player piece that piece must be moved back 3 spaces or if that space is occupied to the next available vacant space.

124561.name: Pink Sweets: Ibara Sorekara
124561.description:
Pink Sweets: Ibara Sorekara (ピンクスウィーツ ～鋳薔薇それから～?) is a manic shooter by Cave, with heavy Raizing influences. It was released in Japanese arcades during the second Quarter of 2006. Pink Sweets is the sequel to Ibara, and features the stage 1-5 bosses from Ibara as playable characters. Pink Sweets was released on Xbox 360 in a bundle pack with Muchi-Muchi Pork. The compilation disc is now out of print.

In Pink Sweets, Mother Teresa, the sixth Guardian in Ibara, did not die. Neither did any of the Rose sisters. We know this because they’re back in Cave’s Pink Sweet’s where they’ve shifted from the dark side to the light. Players get to pilot the gals and use a barrier/shot system to defeat flitting enemies as well as end level bosses of the pastel-colored type. Enemies besides bosses are named after food. The first boss looks like a tinker toy version of Robby the Robot from the Forbidden Planet. During the game, the gals yelp and intonate various sayings to steel themselves for battle.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pink Sweets: Ibara Sorekara", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

124562.name: Muchi Muchi Pork!
124562.description:
User Summary

Muchi Muchi Pork! is a 2007 shoot-em-up by Cave, programmed by ex-Raizing employee Yagawa. It has many features typical to the games Yagawa made while he was with Raizing, including large hitboxes; large, elongated bullets; multiple shot types on every character; and a "dynamic difficulty" system that causes the game to become more difficult if the player does not die for a long period, and causes the game to become easier if the player does die.

124563.name: bodyIQ: Premium
124563.description:
bodyIQ - Premium is a game about the body, how it works, how to improve it and physical exercises.

Basically it a trivia game with a twist. There are 12 categories. 10 based on some of the bodys most important organs, 1 health check and 1 physical excersise, 600 questions/task all in all. Each turn the player roll the die, and moves his marker along the paths of the body. Depending on the space the player ends on, he will either get a question, a health check or a physical task to do. If he answers correct, or performs the task, he will win the card, giving him a number of years.

For younger players there is a multriple choise option.

There are three suggestend ways to end the game:
1) Play until one player reaches 100 years.
2) Play until one player collects all 12 categories.
3) Play for a certaing amount of time.
Whoever has the most points (=years) at the end of the game wins.

124564.description:
Age of Steam: Tibet and Cyprus is another pair of expansions for the Age of Steam board game, with new maps and new rules for each setting.

In Tibet, players may enroll sherpa discs to help them deliver cubes through otherwise impassable mountains.

In Cyprus, a three-player only map, one player will play the Greeks, another the Turks, and the third the UNO (United Nations Organization) forces. Each player has his own particular strengths and weaknesses.
124564.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Tibet and Cyprus

124565.description:
Age of Steam: Las Vegas and Korea (N&S) is another pair of expansions for the Age of Steam board game, with new maps and new rules for each setting.

In Las Vegas, players visit the famed gambling town, trying to build their network as usual while also paying attention to the money on the board.

In Korea (N&S), the cost to build track varies depending on which side of Korea players build upon – but in the wealthy South, there are more cubes to deliver than in the poor North. Delivery between North and South becomes more and more difficult as the game progresses.
124565.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Las Vegas and Korea (N&S)

124566.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Promotional Anti-Hero for the Dungeon player to be used with Caverns of Roxor. Each level expansion for Super Dungeon Explore will feature its own Hero or Anti-Hero.


Lord Vulcanis was cast from the marble halls of Celestia due to his fiery temper and bellicose nature. Since his fall he has focused his considerable might on destroying the Celestials’ realm.

Filled with fury at his continued failure he has sent his Heralds across Crystalia to rally the dark races to his banner and subjugate those who would oppose him.

Contents of the box:
1 Fully Assembled Herald of Vulcanis Miniature - 1x Herald of Vulcanis Game Card - 1x Unique Herald of Vulcanis Treasure Card.

v2
1 x Herald of Vulcanis, Assembled Model
2 x Herald of Vulcanis, Mini-Boss Cards
1 x Dark Centurion, Hero Card
1 x Vulcanis's Maul, Treasure Card
124566.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Herald of Vulcanis

124567.name: The Frozen Tundra
124567.description:
From publisher blurb:

It has now been 3 weeks since I fell into this frozen valley below the Floating Continent, 3 weeks since I’ve seen any of my companions. Surely they must think me lost. The balloon was a foolhardy attempt anyway, one I would not have posed had we been on the surface world, but that continent is just too curious a place.

124568.name: Hunter-Prey
124568.description:
From publisher blurb:

Although hunting a wounded beast in winter would seem simple enough, the darkness of eternal twilight, combined with the constant fall of fresh snow can mask even the heaviest of trails in minutes. Then, for a cunning ambush predator such as the Ka’kau Puh, well adapted with natural camouflage, the hunt becomes that much the harder. Such, though, are the requirements of many such native “tests of manhood.”

124569.name: Dablo Aasele
124569.description:
A game within the Dablo(t) family. Related to the Sami boardgame Dablot Prejjesne and to Dablo Daares.

Theme: Abstract game with soldiers and kings

Gameplay: Turnbased checkers type of game

Goal of the game: Either to capture the enemy king or reduce his forces so that only the king remains

Rules: All pieces move by single steps and can capture, by the short leap, in all directions. The soldier ("dårake") can only step in the three forward directions. Promotion does not occur. For the soldier, capture is mandatory. For the king ("gånneka") capture is optional. One can only capture a piece of the same rank or lower. Where the king is of higher rank than the soldier.

A piece moves to an empty adjacent point. If an adjacent point is occupied by an enemy piece, of the same rank or lower, and the point directly behind is vacant, then one may jump over it and capture it, as in checkers. Several pieces may be captured like this in a single turn. Dablo Frostviken follows the same rules. For soldiers a capture is mandatory. For the king a capture is optional.

124570.name: The Crystal Garden
124570.description:
From publisher blurb:

Although hunting a wounded beast in winter would seem simple enough, the darkness of eternal twilight, combined with the constant fall of fresh snow can mask even the heaviest of trails in minutes. Then, for a cunning ambush predator such as the Ka’kau Puh, well adapted with natural camouflage, the hunt becomes that much the harder. Such, though, are the requirements of many such native “tests of manhood.”

124571.name: Land of G'Wralth
124571.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a beast the as powerful as G'Wralth to have human-like intelligence is terrifying at best. Such a creature could easily foil traps, or understand how man’s weapons work, and devise ways to counter them. Imagine an Allosaurus wearing body armor and using a cannon-sized flintlock musket. Such a beast could easily overpower a cities defenses and reign dominance over a great land. Let us hope G’Wralth never figures out how to use the First Walker flying machine.

124572.name: For My Thoughts
124572.description:
From publisher blurb:

Publishers Note: The following pages were found in the back of one of Dr. Turners Journals, hidden in the back binding. They were square folded and neatly placed, but appeared to have been crumpled or discarded at some point before being stored in the Journal.

124573.name: Pu-Quoi Cannon
124573.description:
From publisher blurb:

Although the use of bamboo, leaf and sap with which to build a musket may seem a tad far fetched, human history does ring with a few examples of unusual (or non-metal) materials being used to manufacture firearms.

124574.name: Assassination!
124574.description:
From publisher blurb:

I’m alive. Always a miracle, but doubly so given the attack last night. Had it not been for the quick thinking of Carolyn and the heroics of Mr. Bryce, me and my manuscripts might have perished in the fires as well...

124575.name: Home
124575.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s good to be home. I’m not really sure when I started thinking of this towering rock as home, or for that matter, when I started thinking of anyplace in this Hollow World as home, but here it is. Two months of the Surface have reminded me of the pitiful savagery of mankind. Our need for “conquest” and destruction, and to suppress that which we don’t understand or wish to control. At least down in here the savagery is due to the laws of nature, and not the lines on a piece of paper.

124576.name: The Astrolabe & Prybar
124576.description:
From publisher blurb:

We had a rather curious accident today, Rufus fell down. While that in of itself is not that uncommon as the poor fellow seems to have a knack for poor agility and an equal form of luck, what is odd is the manner in which he fell. He was drawn to the ground, pulled by an unseen force, and there he remained, unable to stand until removed of his backpack, which remained held steadfast to the ground.

124577.name: Wreck of the Lady Angel
124577.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anyway, while walking this jungle yesterday, our eyes were directed to a large object high up in the trees. A twisted shape, a metal form, like a cross. Thur-Long, Bryce and the soldier Jeremy quickly climbed up and discovered it to be a wrecked aircraft trapped in the trees. She was a three engine craft, wore English Army Insignias and had a rather beautiful, abet provocative, lady nose art with the words “Lady Angel” written below it.

124578.name: Fog
124578.description:
From publisher blurb:

I am not even sure how to begin this journal entry as the details of the last 24 hours are as terrifying as they are wondrous, and our physical exhaustion only adds to our confusion, and the fact that my pocket clock only showed that only a few minutes had passed adds to the mystery. Do I contest Dr. Connor's explanation of the events, or leave my own evidence hidden up my sleeve?

124579.name: The Secret Garden
124579.description:
From publisher blurb:

Walking about these lush jungles, with their tropical flowers and amazing wildlife reminds me of a time from when I was around 10. My mother and I had visited the home of one of daddy’s friends, Lord Arthur David Wright of Yorkshire. Daddy and Lord Wright were off fighting the Kaiser in the Great War. Both were pilots of Royal Army Biplanes and were flying over places like France, Germany and Holland.

124580.name: Them!
124580.description:
From publisher blurb:

As I type this sort of Field Note for my own record, it occurs to me that nobody will ever be able to read it as all of this information has been listed as Top Secret by the United States Government, so I guess this note is for my reference only.

124581.name: 3 Generations After The End
124581.description:
Publisher Blurb

Civilization has collapsed, leaving behind a world of savage creatures and super science. This is your guide to that world. 3 Generations After The End is a small post-apocalyptic setting for tabletop role-playing games. Developed as a system-agnostic setting, and each monster includes stats for Dungeons & Dragons 4E, Gamma World 4E, Savage Worlds, FATE, and Apocalypse World.

124582.name: Voidjumpers of Space
124582.description:
Publisher Blurb

A new setting, compatible with 4e, by Brent Newhall. This is an attempt to re-capture the overall flavor of Spelljammer, with a new universe. So, this is not an attempt to clone Spelljammer; it’s not Spelljammer with the serial numbers filed off. That would both annoy Wizards of the Coast and be far less fun than creating a new set of races, classes, etc. This second release contains greatly expanded adventures, expanded stat blocks (Essentials-style), new ship types, a much cleaner layout, and many more small improvements.

124583.name: Deception
124583.description: A card game played with a standard 52-card deck and a mat that outline potential card plays. Players take turns placing cards out on the display mat, scoring melds of 3 cards as they do. On a single card play, it's possible to play two melds, with face cards acting as multipliers.

124584.description:
This is a 100 card expansion for Phantoms of the Ice. It includes 25 offense and 19 defense players as well as 11 new goalies and 42 cards of playing money and 3 position card, one each for goalie, offense, and defense. There is no box and no rules.

Initially this was planned to be released as a new version of Phantoms of the Ice called Power Play and published by Fun Connection. There were new rules for trading and a player market. Although Fun Connections decided to stop producing anymore games, White Wind was able to get the cards printed with their logo on the back and sold those 100 cards as an expansion sets.
124584.name: Phantoms of the Ice: Expansion Card Set

124585.name: Floatin' Assult
124585.description:
User Summary

Floati'n Assult [sic] is a browser-based shmup game. Players pick one of 2 styles of ship and attempt to survive through 3 stages of increasing difficulty while earning a high score. Each ship has 5 lives, as well as a limited stock of options which can be used for a temporary shield or firepower boost. Movement is handled with the mouse and firing/options with the keyboard.

124586.name: Ultra Starfire
124586.description:
ULTRA STARFIRE is the fifth edition of the Starfire game system. Continuing improvements on the basic Starfire combat system, Ultra Starfire is comprised of two parts: the tactical combat system and the campaign system.

The tactical combat system is a fast-paced fleet-level war game of starship combat, still using the same simple combat system designed back in 1976. The campaign system is an empire-level economic war game where the player starts with an alien race on a single world and attempts to conquer the galaxy. Battles from the campaign system are played-out using the tactical system.

Ultra Starfire is a partial rewrite to Galactic Starfire, Fourth edition. Ultra Starfire was designed for completely balanced game play in a player versus player competitive environment. While it could still be used for story-based games, the appendixes and additional material was designed for shorter competitive campaigns.

Ultra Starfire was the first all-electronic product from the SDS, sold as a set of cross-linked PDF files, but still used the counters and map sets from Galactic Starfire.

Re-implements:

Galactic Starfire

124587.name: Commando Quarterly (Volume 1, Issue 1 - Summer 3067)
rpgissuearticle: News From The Front: Recounting battles from around the Inner Sphere
Simulator Tech: Scenario - Blooding On Pandora
Tactical Analysis: Light ‘Mechs on the Modern Battlefield (3060+)
124587.description:
User Summary

Tactical Analysis from Ron Barter,
A new short story by Jason Weiser,
New Simulator Tech,
And more.

124588.name: Commando Quarterly (Volume 1, Issue 2 - Autumn 3067)
rpgissuearticle: Simulator Tech: Scenario #1 - Recon, In Force
Simulator Tech: Scenario #2 - The Hunt For November-231
Simulator Tech: Scenario #3 - Vive la Patrie!
124588.description:
User Summary

Tactical Analysis from Ron Barter,
Brother against Brother by Jason Weiser,
New Simulator Tech,
And more.

124589.name: Flame War
124589.description:
In the card game Flame War, each player takes the role of a forum admin. Starting threads, posting, flaming, maybe some trolling, and perhaps even bringing up a certain pony that might in fact be little and belong to someone you know...

Flame War is a fun and clever game about running a forum. Every card in the game represents a post made by a forum member, often directed at another member. Some are informational, some are random, and some are downright mean. The internet is a scary place for folks who like to read what other people write. Closing down threads scores you points, and the player who scores the most points when the game ends wins.

124590.description:
Call to Glory, packaged in a mid-sized tin box, is a fast and fun card game in which players try to collect Japanese characters of different values. When a player has two or more cards of the same character in his hand, he can (possibly) lay these cards on the table and score them at the end of the round. If, however, an opponent lays out more cards of the same type, then characters of that type already on the table are discarded. When the game ends, players score for the types of characters they have on the table.

Call to Glory comes with two variants:


"Imperial Tasks" in which players can fulfill specific tasks for extra points.
"The Power of the Ninja" in which the Ninja cards become more powerful.


Unlike Crazy Chicken, Call to Glory is playable with 2 to 4 players. Drive is playable with 4 players, but does not have the two variants.
124590.name: Call to Glory

124591.name: Shake Numbers
124591.description:
Game consists of 10 numbered dice and two spotted dice.

In a turn, the ten numbered dice are thrown and then the two spotted dice. From the ten dice you may take any number of them that total the number rolled with the spotted dice.
i.e. you roll 9 with the spotted dice: you can now take away any combination of the numbered dice that add up to 9.
If successful, you throw again, and so on.

When you cannot take way the number rolled, the total of the remaing dice are added together and that is your score.

The player with the lowest score after an agreed number of rounds, wins.

124592.name: Family Farm
124592.description:
Family Farm is an innovative tycoon game in the setting of 19th century farmsteads. It's a simulation of a farmstead experienced in stories which span a generation. Clicking cows won't earn you any cash! You control characters with RPG-like attributes, skills and needs. Keep them fed, develop their skills, upgrade house to accommodate a bigger family and grow their land in to a Family Farm!

Source: The Publisher Website.

124594.name: Par-Delà les Montagnes Hallucinées
124594.description:
Translated from the back cover:

"1930. Miskatonic University organized an expedition of exploration in the Antarctic. Several strange discoveries had been made there but few testimonies were given by the rare survivors.

“The Mountains of Madness”, a story penned by Howard Phillips Lovecraft, talks about those events.

Today, 1933, the Starkweather – Moore expedition is preparing to follow the trail of the first one. They will leave New York to head to the heart of the Antarctic, searching for answers to the many questions and traces left by their predecessors.

The investigators will participate to the fantastic human adventure and will try to survive by facing many hazards of life, as well as the forces of nature.

This book constitutes the biggest campaign ever written for The Call of Cthulhu. Dozens of hours of exhausting and chilling gameplay, thousands of kilometers to travel, tons of pemmican to eat…

This [French] edition goes much further than the US and constitutes a fully updated version, with about 300 pages of scenario, appendixes, photographs, pictures, descriptions and maps that have been added.

Expect to live a unique experience that you will remember forever…"

124597.name: Diva!
124597.description:
Players take on the role of an emerging opera star, gaining education and training to get jobs and roles in hopes of becoming the next opera superstar!

Education and training are gained through drafting cards from the standard deck and putting these cards in play by "purchasing" them out of your hand. Job and Role cards are won at the end of each round as players qualify for and bid on the face up Opportunity cards.

The object of the game is to be the Diva with the most stars at the end of the game. Stars are earned by collecting Role cards and drawing Special cards.

124598.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Long ago, in the ancient city of the Mayan empire, nine temples were built with different stone blocks, but the blocks were all mixed up!

Luckily, great priests held the knowledge of powerful magic, and they can rebuild the towers without damaging them. Now they compete to create nine single-colored towers by exchanging the massive blocks of stone between them. If one of them can join the colored stones together, he will earn the right to decorate the tower with his own ladder. And if he can build an entire tower in a single color he will earn a special reward: His followers alone will forever greet the sun from the top of the tower!

In Maya, as one of these mighty priests, can you outwit your opponents and rerrange the stones of the nine towers?
124598.name: Maya
boardgamepodcastepisode: The One About Auld Lang Syne

124599.name: Jabba-Dabba-Dû!
124599.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In those far-off days when people had already ceased to live on the trees, but did not yet know how to make cars, the main occupation of men was hunting. Neither mighty mammoth, nor nosy ground squirrel – indeed, not any animal could escape the watchful eyes of experienced hunters.

In Jabba-Dabba-Dû!, you'll become the chief hunter of a tribe and go to the hunting grounds as the head of the mighty men. Get the most thick and tasty mammoth, and bring it to your women. But beware as your tribe in not the only one on these plains – and these frail parodies of men consider themselves hunters, too! Prove that it's not true! Leave them behind in pursuit of the prey!

124600.name: Salem 1692
124600.description:
From the publisher's website:

After the New Year dawned on 1692, strange afflictions have beset many of the young girls in Salem. Thought to be the precocious nonsense of children, they now suffer episodes of violence and terrifying abuse at the hands of unseen forces. Their forbidden games have brought this onslaught, and they have learned them at the hands of their very neighbors and servants.

Inevitable accusations have now followed. As young as five to as old as eighty, no resident of Salem Village or the surrounding townships, good Christians or no, old or young, are safe from the witch hunt. 1692 will be a year of misery and death for all of Salem Village. Truly, spells and stories are not simple children’s games.

124601.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Dark Rages, a new expansion to the competitive deck-building game Nightfall, brings you a complete all-new set of cards with special powers, and features new vampires, werewolves, hunters and ghouls.

Dark Rages also introduces new Avatar cards that allow you to customize your decks' themes like never before! Will you be a Vampire Overlord or a Werewolf Alpha – and with which other groups will you ally?
124601.name: Nightfall: Dark Rages

124602.name: Covert
124602.description:
Under the concept "Playing with Art", Rui Alípio Monteiro came up with Covert, a game that is based on the Rock, Scissor, Paper game. The "Thread" has been added to balance things out. Although mainly for kids, this is a great game to be played by adults alike.

The idea is to make kids become familiar with geometric shapes and colours as well as doing basic maths at the same time.
- The Scissor wins against both the Thread and the Paper.
- The String wins against both the Rock and the Paper.
- The Paper wins against the Rock
- The Rock wins against the Scissor

So, according to the power of each object, these are worth either 1 or 2 Points. Each shape appears several times, so players will be able to make calculated guesses on what would be the best piece to play at a given time. The stakes increase if both players play the same piece simultaneously, since these will accumulate to the Victory Points.

A game to be played in little time with net to no set-up time! Check out more info here:
www.criacoesasolo.com

124604.name: The Terror of Atlcalli
124604.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are many tales told by the peoples of the Hollow Earth of statues which walk and act like man. Most of these tales are either simple misunderstandings or downright falsehoods designed to scare children or keep fearful populations in check...

...Every once in a while, however, one of these stories turns out to be true, more or less. Such is the tale of the Terror of Atlcalli.

124605.name: Skull Island: The World of Kong
124605.description:
From publisher blurb:

A HEX bestiary focused on Skull Island, the home of King Kong. The creatures and inhabitants of Skull Island as detailed in the coffee table book Skull Island: The World of Kong are statted up so GMs everywhere can terrorize their players.
To make things even easier, the document is broken down by geography with a final section on plot hooks, as follows:

The Crumbling Coast and Village
The Shrinking Lowlands
The Winding Waterways
The Steaming Jungle
The Abyssal Chasms
The Barren Uplands
Plot Hooks

124606.name: Automobiles of the World
rpgseries: Secrets of the Surface World Web Enhancement
124606.description:
From Introduction:

This Web Enhancement provides a wide array of automobiles for nations outside of the USA, as well as several new automobiles expanding the American selection.

The Costs in the tables have been adjusted for reasons of game balance, though actual historical prices are included in the descriptions of the vehicles for those desiring greater accuracy. Similarly, the Speeds in the tables are rounded for ease of use.

124607.name: RMS Titanic: The Millionaire's Special
124607.description:
From the publisher's website:
First Class on the Titanic is exciting in itself but when you are invited to a private viewing of one of the world’s great curiosities, you jump at the chance. The mummy of Hettunaway, Priestess of Amun-Ra, the Unlucky Mummy is being shipped to New York and donated to the Metropolitan Museum of Art by its owner, Jefferson Shaw. Legend has it that those who look upon her face are doomed. Jefferson Shaw’s intentions are not as philanthropic as they seem. Strange rituals, a device to contact spirits and the awakening of something he cannot control.

The Titanic is on a collision course with an iceberg but will it be the icy water that kills you or the ancient force, finally unleashed?

The Millionaire’s Special is a short adventure for Trail of Cthulhu by Adam Gauntlett (Not So Quiet, Hell Fire, Flying Coffins). This is to celebrate the centenary year of the Titanic’s tragic sinking.
All proceeds from the sale of this adventure will go to the Heroes in the Dark charity. This adventure is available to buy for $2.50/£1.50 from the Pelgrane Shop and other outlets.

124608.name: Kingdom & Commonwealth Omnibus 1
124608.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first two adventures of the epic Kingdom & Commonwealth Campaign, fully revised and updated for the Renaissance rules for Clockwork & Chivalry 2nd Edition.

Volume I: The Alchemist's Wife

January 1646, and the land is in the grip of an icy winter. From Prince Rupert’s capital of Oxford, the Adventurers set out on a quest for the missing wife of a high-ranking Alchemist. Ahead of them, a ruthless Parliamentarian agent leaves a trail of destruction; behind them, a mysterious figure dogs their footsteps. They are bound for the tainted lands around Naseby, where the magickal aftermath of alchemical warfare blights the countryside. Beyond lie the clockwork weapon-shops of Cambridge and a deadly climax which could re-ignite the smouldering embers of Civil War.

Volume II: Thou Shalt Not Suffer

There are those who claim that witches don't exist! They also claim that tales of curses and crop blights, of midnight sabbats and dark conspiracies, are the fevered imaginings of fanatical witch finders. Those people have never been to Cornwall.

In that wild and sea-girt land, the Witch Queen rules through sorcery and fear, and the Royalist majority seem to be in thrall to her evil will.

The Adventurers are sent on a mission to this bleak, remote and sinister place, where they must struggle through a maze of witches, wreckers and pirates, miners, fanatics and superstitious peasants, to find the truth behind a growing evil which could swallow up the whole of England.

124609.name: Tales of Beasts and Perils, vol. 1
124609.description:
From the publisher's website:

TALES OF BEASTS AND PERILS VOLUME ONE

Become a creator of worlds!

Tales of Beasts and Perils is a gamemaster's guide to writing and running adventures for the Tales of Blades and Heroes fantasy roleplaying game.

It includes rules and guidelines for:


Secret Knowledge rolls;
Timing and pacing an adventure;
Rewarding players with experience, Hero points, and loot;
Creating magic items;
Dangers of the world, including traps, poison, disease, falling damage,curses, slimes, jellies, molds, fear, and encounters with dangerous beasts and humanoids;
New special rules to create monsters;
Monsters and foes, including detailed profiles for unicorns, dark unicorns, dragons, iron devourers, giant spiders, chimeras, Coroimba savages, Undead, and humanoids;
Guidelines for balancing encounters;
Sample special rules for typical fantasy races;
and a point cost summary of all the abilities featured in Tales of Blades and Heroes and Tales of Beasts and Perils.


This PDF version comes in a full color, 47 page illustrated version; an inksaving version with all illustrations and page backgrounds removed; and an inksaving, compressed version (just the rules in a smaller type so you can print them saving both ink and paper).

124610.description:
Game description from the publisher:

A war hero son of the Union's brilliant president, Colonel James Curtis Edison was executing dangerous missions before his eighteenth birthday. Armed with the best weapons and technology the Union can muster, Edison is a one man army, capable of bringing down the largest of soldiers with the flick of a switch and a pull of a trigger.

Tannhäuser: Edison includes one beautifully painted figure and accompanying character sheet, an all-new scenario, and all the tokens and equipment cards necessary to bring Edison's inspiring leadership to your battles.
124610.name: Tannhäuser: Edison

124611.name: Civil Aircraft
rpgseries: Secrets of the Surface World Web Enhancement
124611.description:
From Introduction:

This Web Enhancement provides a selection of additional civil aircraft appropriate for the Golden Age of Aviation.

The Costs in the tables have been adjusted for reasons of game balance, though actual historical prices are included in the descriptions of the vehicles for those desiring greater accuracy. Similarly, the Speeds in the tables are rounded for ease of use.

124612.name: Foreign Handguns
rpgseries: Secrets of the Surface World Web Enhancement
124612.description:
From Introduction:

This Web Enhancement provides a selection of handguns for nations outside of the USA, reflecting the popularity of small, easy-to-carry 6.35mm (.25 ACP) automatics among the civilian populace of Europe.

The Costs in the tables have been adjusted for reasons of game balance, though actual historical prices are included in the descriptions of the handguns for those desiring greater accuracy.

124613.name: Foreign Motorcycles
rpgseries: Secrets of the Surface World Web Enhancement
124613.description:
From Introduction:

This Web Enhancement provides a selection of motorcycles for nations outside of the USA.

The Costs in the tables have been adjusted for reasons of game balance, though actual historical prices are included in the descriptions of the vehicles for those desiring greater accuracy. Similarly, the Speeds in the tables are rounded for ease of use.

124614.name: The World's Major Militaries: Italy and its Colonies
rpgseries: Secrets of the Surface World Web Enhancement
124614.description:
User summary:

A collection of Italian military weapons and vehicles for use with HEX.

124615.name: Military Aircraft of the World
rpgseries: Secrets of the Surface World Web Enhancement
124615.description:
From Introduction:

This Web Enhancement provides a selection of additional military aircraft for the nations featured in Secrets of the Surface World.

The Speeds in the table have been rounded for ease of use, though actual historical speeds are included in the descriptions of the aircraft for those desiring greater accuracy.

124616.name: Nations in Turmoil
rpgseries: Secrets of the Surface World Web Enhancement
124616.description:
From Introduction:

This Web Enhancement provides an overview of the range of international weapons and vehicles employed in the civil war in Spain. It also covers China due to the ongoing civil conflict there, as well as continued hostilities with Japan following the latter’s establishment of the illegitimate state of Manchukuo in Manchuria four years ago, its thwarted invasion of Shanghai at the same time, its invasion of Jehol province in 1933, and its current invasion of Suiyuan.

The Speeds in the vehicle table have been rounded for ease of use, though actual historical speeds are included in the descriptions of the aircraft for those desiring greater accuracy.

124617.name: Period Prices and Extra Details
rpgseries: Secrets of the Surface World Web Enhancement
124617.description:
From Introduction:

The prices of all items in the "T. F. Arkington's Lifestyle Emporium" chapter of Secrets of the Surface World were adjusted to take game balance into account. Additionally, some information had to be cut due to necessity, and other numbers, such as Speeds, were rounded for ease of use.

This Web Enhancement provides the actual period prices for use by any GMs interested more in historical authenticity, as well as extra details and information.

Note that prices are not provided for the large multitude of military weapons and vehicles in the supplement as such weapons and vehicles are not for sale.

124618.name: Richie Rich'$ Rich Man-Poor Man Card Game
124618.description: This hand-management card game is a rummy variant that is themed on the Richie Rich comic book character. The deck consist of 36 cards, 2 each of 18 professions, ranging from Hobo to Skywriter to Doctor. After dealing the shuffled cards to the players, the first player draws a card from the person to her right. She then lays down all matched pairs in her hand. Play continues to the left. The last player to have a card in her hand wins.

124621.name: The Hundred Books (Issue 3 - May 1999)
124621.description: The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

124622.description:
The first in the Death or Glory! series, In Magnificent Style is a solitaire game depicting the final desperate Confederate attack on 3 July 1863 at the Battle of Gettysburg, popularly known as Pickett’s Charge. As General Longstreet, you must decide how quickly to press your troops across this deadly open ground before allowing the men to regroup for another bound. But time is not on your side, and the longer your stalwart soldiers remain in this maelstrom of enemy fire.. the more dangerous it becomes, and the less likely they will arrive with the verve and numbers required to carry the day.

With only five turns in which to reach your objective and attack, how far can you push your luck? Your options are simple: Death or Glory!

Game Data:

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 9 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each turn is approx. 10 minutes of real time

Game Components:

• One color Rules sheet
• 11" x 17" map
• 1 Player Aid sheet
• 45 double-sided 1/2" round small troop markers
• 28 double-sided 5/8" round large troop markers
• 20 double-sided 1/2" square counters
124622.name: In Magnificent Style
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 65: Andy Loakes, designer of Toulon 1793

124623.name: The Princess Bride Game
124623.description:
The Princess Bride Game is a casual video game developed and published by New York game development studio Worldwide Biggies. The game is based on The Princess Bride, a movie by Rob Reiner.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Princess Bride Game", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

124624.description:
From the publisher:

"The "Hasty Positions Normandy Expansion" brings further depth and exciting gameplay to the world of SMG."

"Each terrain piece has integrated modifiers for SHOOT, LOOK, HIDE and MOVE exactly like your terrain tiles, making it easier to defend your areas of the map. Placing your positions to hold key areas of movement or setting up interlocking fields of fire will require the use of different tactics to keep the enemy at bay. Your opponent will have to employ various strategies to attempt to overwhelm your positions. Will he resort to rushing your position with a handful of grenades? Or will he try to set up a fire base and overwhelm you with more firepower? Or will your machine guns pin him down while the artillery you called from your Field Telephone falls on him from overhead."

"Each of the foxholes comes with it's own set of Story Cards, adding new Story Events for each position, and comes with new Order Cards tasking you to Hold your position . A Field Telephone can even be added to a position to call in off board Mortar or Artillery support to help in your defense."

"Each piece comes fully illustrated with easy assembly instructions. All of the terrain is made from the same high quality, sturdy material as your SMG maps so you know that you are receiving a highly durable product that can give you years of enjoyment."

Terrain ups the level of game play by introducing new elements of strategy and planning into the game through use of 3D terrain. New scenarios are included surrounding the new terrain involved.
124624.name: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Hasty Positions Normandy Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Day of Days

124625.name: Where's Waldo Now? Colorforms Game
124625.description: This is a simple game in which players spin A spinner to collect Colorform pieces that correspond to their player mat. The game comes with two sets of Colorforms that depict characters from the Where's Waldo Now book. The Colorforms are placed randomly on the spinner at the start of the game. Each turn, a player spins the spinner and can collect a Colorform from the quadrant of the spinner that the arrow points to provided the sticker matches their player mat. The first player to collect all four characters for their mat wins.

124627.name: Smash Cops
124627.description:
Our first title, Smash Cops, is an exciting new iOS action racing game with unique and intuitive driving controls specifically designed for touch and available in the iTunes App Store from 12/01/12. [Ed. note: Actually released one week later.]

As the police in Americas wildest TV chases, players smash felons off the road in a high production, large, free roaming and beautifully rendered city with aerial coverage of the pursuit and TV style ‘breaking news’.

With 20 missions and 5 different vehicles players complete escape, challenge and pursuit activities, collecting stars for their police badge to access new parts of the city and new more powerful vehicles. Smash Cops is ridiculous fun in short sharp bursts of play.

Smash Cops uses innovative new push controls using a single finger to control and steer your car in a way that is natural and fun, easy for all yet challenging for the console player too and enabled with Gamecenter for achievements and leaderboards.

Smash Cops is optimised for iPad1 and iPhone4 and enhanced for iPhone4s and iPad2 enjoying even richer graphics to take advantage of the extra power. Its also possible via Airplay to mirror the action from iPhone4S or iPad2 to your TV

Source: The Developer Website.

124628.name: Origami Adventure
124628.description:
Origami Adventure is Done Right Studios’ first project and is currently in development for the iPod, iPhone, and iPad. Origami Adventure is a real-time puzzle game that will challenge players to score big points in over 60 levels by creating a variety of origami animals. Each animal has a different speed and point value, so quick thinking and perfect timing will be required to rack up enough points to earn the elusive Foiled Crane on each level!

We are proud to say that Origami Adventure will be localized in 8 different languages: English, French, Korean, Japanese, Italian, German, Spanish, and Simplified Chinese. Coupled with the worldwide reach of Apple’s products, we hope that gamers all over the globe will enjoy their own Origami Adventure!

Source: The Developer Website.

124629.name: Bravo Force: Last Stand
124629.description:
Shoot for survival!

Let's be honest. When your helicopter crash lands in enemy territory, you know you’re in trouble.

“Prepare yourself soldier, for the most intense battle of your life.”

Bravo Force has been shot down in enemy territory and YOU are the last survivor.

‘Join the Fight’ and cause total destruction in this epic arcade shooting game. Unleash Airstrikes, Gunships and other powerful perks to help you annihilate the relentless enemy waves.

Get yourself promoted!

Level up through the 50 different ranks of Bravo Force!

Earn experience by playing the game and completing over 175 fun and challenging missions.

Can you become the Supreme Commander of Bravo Force?

Play online with friends!

Have Facebook? Show off your rank, receive free gifts, challenge your friends, top the leaderboard and post huge scores to earn bragging rights galore amongst your Facebook friends.

What are you waiting for, soldier? Get on the battlefield!

Source: The Game Website.

124631.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 15 No 2 - February 2012)
124631.description: In this issue: The Gunnery Chair, Special Features, Articles, Independent Autoduellists, Games, Rulebooks and Supplements, Blog Posts, Forum Discussions, Modeling Tips and Photo Galleries, Blasts from the Past, Console and Computer Games, Movies, Online Videos, Dead Links, Social Media, Autoduelling Technology Today, & The Cracked Windshield.

124632.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 15 No 3 - May 2012)
rpgissuearticle: abletop Games: Survivors of the Fire
124632.description: In this issue: The Gunnery Chair, Ogre Designer's Edition Kickstarter, Car Wars Headquarters, Tabletop Games, Tabletop Games: Survivors of the Fire, Blog Posts, Forum Discussions, Miniatures, Movies, Online Videos, Podcasts, Wiki Entries, Autoduelling Technology Today, & The Cracked Windshield.

124633.name: Four Little N***** Boys
124633.description:
British target shooting game. Title now would be very non-PC, but it was acceptable 60 years ago.

Nice graphics for the targets, four negro children waiting to be knocked down with your pop-gun rifle that fired corks.

The first to reach a pre-agreed total of successful hits, wins.

124634.name: Happy Party Game: Boat Race
124634.description:
Unusual word game. Each guest is given a sheet of twelve statements about words. Half will get an Oxford sheet, the other half a Cambridge sheet.

The Oxford sheet answers are all words using the letters in the word 'Oxford'. The Cambridge sheet answers are all words using the letters in the word 'Cambridge'.

After time runs out, the guest with the most right answers, wins.

124635.name: Travelling To?
124635.description: Party game. 16 cards are placed around the room where they can all be seen by the guests. Each card has a rhyming clue to a place. Guests taking part write down their answers and the one with the most correct when the host calls "Time", wins.

124636.name: EuroMecz
124636.description:
Euromatch is a tactical sports game. The game shows how the match outcome is influenced by the tactical arrangement of your power. It is essential that the arrangement of our team is adopted to the opponent’s tactics.

The objective of the game is to outscore your opponent, playing cards on the board.

Elements of the game
1. Two decks of 15 cards (white and grey)
2. The pitch game board
3. The tube for marking the score of the 1st match (useful in a two-match game)


Euromecz jest sportową grą taktyczną. Gra pokazuje, jaki wpływ na wynik meczu ma taktyczne rozmieszczenie naszych sił. Ważne jest, aby ustawienie naszej drużyny było dobrane do taktyki przeciwnika.

Celem gry jest uzyskanie lepszego bilansu bramkowego w rozgrywanym dwumeczu.

Elementy gry
1. Dwie talie po 15 kart (biała i szara)
2. Plansza boiska
3. Tuba służąca do zaznaczenia wyniku 1-go meczu (przydatne w przypadku dwumeczu)

124637.name: Soul-Thieves of Mars
124637.description:
The heroes are hired by a trade caravan as guards, and travel to the city of Ban Ma Terril. One of the merchants of the city, a weaver named Argol, warns them that something is going on -- people in the city have begun to act strangely: hollow, as if their wills were not their own, as if someone or something had stolen their very souls!

The investigation will lead to mystery, intrigue and murder, as the heroes are drawn into the machinations of a secret society that threatens the entire Red Planet!

(publisher blurb)

124638.description:
Ziege mit Fliege is a memory card game for children.

By turn, cards are placed face down on different piles.
This cards show either a colour, an animal, a piece of clothing or an activity.
4 different cards make one pile. Players have to remember this cards and make a sentence out of this cars, "A green beavers is skateboarding in a diving suit" for example.
124638.name: Ziege mit Fliege
boardgamefamily: HABA Fex: Fostering Executive Functions series

124639.description:
Katzofant is a speed action card game for children.

Tha cards show 5 different animals in diefferent sizes.
Players compare the sizes of the animals on the table and in their hand and imitate the voice of the langest animal.
The fastest player may discard one of his cards.

The first player who gets rid of all his cards is the winner.
124639.name: Katzofant
boardgamefamily: HABA Fex: Fostering Executive Functions series

124640.description:
An influential film director is holding a screening of his latest production in the abandoned estate Whale Manor, and you've been asked to attend! There's just one catch: Whale Manor is haunted by the spirits of dead actors, all of whom are cursed to relive the drama of their films again and again.
House of Fears is a print-on-demand story expansion for Mansions of Madness! This cinematic adventure by acclaimed novelist Tracy Hickman thrusts players into a living 1920s movie – but can they escape the horror before the film's tragic ending?
124640.name: Mansions of Madness: House of Fears

124641.name: Elemental Metals
124641.description:
From publisher blurb:

This free companion product compliments Elemental Gemstones. Unlock the magical secrets of the world's metals with this free download. 23 real world metals are explored, from commonly known metals such as copper and gold, to rare and elusive ones such as duralumin and tantalum, to metals that have been practically forgotten by time such as hepatizon and tumbaga.

This product is useable in any roleplaying system, and will provide game masters and storytellers with plenty of ideas to create their own magical items. Combine with the information in Elemental Gemstones to create true relics of power!

124642.name: Elemental Gemstones
124642.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gemstones have long played an important role in the magical arts. Magic users believe each gem is imbued with its own distinct energies, and that it is possible to tap into those energies for personal gain and insight. Unfortunately, most roleplaying systems have simplified gemstones to the point of uselessness, serving little purpose in gameplay other than as a variable description for a piece of random loot.

Elemental Gemstones offers 70 gemstones with related folklore and reported magical properties. Add a touch of mystery to your game by using the information in this product to develop new ideas for magical items, or add some variety to random treasure rolls.

While this product is designed as a general resource for any game system, it includes supplemental information for the Karma Roleplaying System. The Karma Roleplaying System allows players and storytellers to craft their own spells and magical items, design their own races, and completely customize their characters with a unique point system. Pick up with product for only 99 cents, and then explore the rest of the Karma RPG product line!

124643.name: Karma Quick Guide
124643.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF presents a quick reference guide to some of the rules behind the upcoming Karma Roleplaying System. Get a peek at character creation, spell creation, and learn how experience and training points work. This free download also explains the core game mechanic that will be used for the system.

This Free Download includes:

4 Page Quick Guide
Two Page Character Sheet
Two Page Blank Spellbook for players to keep track of their spells and bonuses from specializations and disciplines
A Conversion Guide for Players and STs that want to convert existing 3.5 characters to Karma
A tracking sheet for STs to keep notes on character stats, reputation, wealth, etc for quick reference

124644.name: Karmic Monster: Sight-Stealer
124644.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need more monsters for your Karma game? Here's one that is sure to scare your players. The Sight-Eater is a frightening alien creature that feeds off the vision of its victims, using psionic powers to blind them. This new monster write up also includes a few bonus story seeds to inspire your game.

124645.name: Karmic Monsters: Blood Dragon
124645.description:
From publisher blurb:

As if dragons weren't tough enough...imagine one that can instantly transform your fallen comrades into mindless undead to fight against you! The Blood Dragon is an all new monster for the Karma Roleplaying System. This is one adversary you don't take lightly.

The Blood Dragon provides storytellers with a monster that isn't meant for a one-off chance combat, but as a long term adversary.

This supplement references information found in Karmic Monsters.

124646.name: Karmic Monsters: Chul'achar
124646.description:
From publisher blurb:

As you cut your way through the thick jungle undergrowth, a small reptilian biped appears in front of you. It stops, tilting its head curiously. At just over 3 ft tall, its awkward appearance and inquisitive nature make it appear harmless. You reach into your backback to offer it a treat, and think maybe it would make an intriguing exotic pet. Unfortunately, you never notice the rest of its pack circling you from behind...

The Chul'achar is a new monster for the Karma Roleplaying System. This supplement includes the complete creature write up and stat block for the system.

As an additional bonus, this supplement also includes a special 3.5 variant for use with the Neiyar: Land of Heaven and the Abyss 3.5 campaign setting.

124647.description:
Top This! is a fun-filled, strategic board game of pizza making for 2 to 5 players. Manage your toppings and flick them skillfully to win!

Players take turns flicking wooden "pizza topping" pieces onto a pizza-like game board. Their goal is to position toppings so as to fulfill orders precisely, while managing their inventory of toppings. Players can earn tips by showing off (by yelling "Top This!" before flicking a topping) or by fulfilling two orders in one turn. The winner is the player with the most money (from orders and tips).
124647.name: Top This! A Pizza Flicking Game
boardgameaccessory: Top This! Veg Substitution Pack
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
boardgamepodcastepisode: Funding the Dream on Kickstarter Ep 69 Uniforge Top This

124648.description:
I Am Vlad: Prince Of Wallachia – an epic board game about the real life of Vlad the Impaler and about the habits, mysteries and actual facts of Wallachia and Transylvania – can be played by two, three or four players. The players begin the game from their own base and each have control over a Vlad hero as well as an Archer and a Wallachian Knight.

During the game, they try to eliminate the opposing Vlad heroes through tactical movements and attacks with their own units. Gameplay takes place on two boards: the Game Map and the Underworld Map. While the Game Map is the board on which all the interactions between players take place (including movement, battles, tactical actions, and the positioning of units and outposts), the Underworld is the area Archers and Wallachian Knights enter once they die in battle. I Am Vlad: Prince Of Wallachia has two types of battles: against enemy units and against neutral units; for both types, players use battle cards, magic cards, tokens, and an eight-sided die. Other tactical actions are made through tokens, gold coins, outposts, and so on.
124648.name: I Am Vlad: Prince of Wallachia
boardgameexpansion: I Am Vlad: Prince Of Wallachia – Bonus Pack

124649.name: RoShamBo
124649.description:
From the game publisher's web site:

"RoShamBo (aka Rock Paper Scissors) is a board game that takes an age-old concept and transforms it into a game like no other on the market — ever. Ro Sham Bo is simple yet complex — an entertaining game that makes play fast, intense, and sometimes personal, but most of all fun.

It's pretty simple (but for those of you who have been living under a rock — no pun intended…) Rock beats scissors, scissors beats paper, paper beats rock. Got it so far?

Players advance toward the winner's level by rolling the dice or by winning challenges.

However, more is at stake than just winning the game (on the board) — challenges can go beyond traditional game play.

Along the way players land on spaces that call for challenges that range from moving ahead a few spaces and changing places with the winner, to being everyone's butler for the rest of the game, or doing a crazy stunt or challenge of the cardholder's choice.

124650.name: The Lathe Worlds
124650.description:
From the publisher's website:

In the Imperium of Man, technology is commonplace...but it is also mysterious and unfathomable. Such knowledge is the carefully guarded domain of the Adeptus Mechanicus, and has been for thousands of years. They are the Cult of the Machine God, worshipping the Emperor as their Omnissiah, the Perfect Sum of All Knowledge. Their Explorator fleets search across the galaxy for lost knowledge from ages long past. Their mechanically augmented tech-priests on thousands of forge worlds strive to preserve what precious little data they retain. Both quests continue, though they are mere flickering candles against the oppressive darkness of stagnation and ignorance. With each century, actual understanding descends to dogma, rote instruction, and myth, as priceless knowledge is lost forever.

Within the Calixis Sector, the Adeptus Mechanicus is centered on the Lathe Worlds, and from these three planets the Mechanicum oversees its domains of forge worlds, research stations, orbitals, and even entire systems. From these worlds, precious knowledge and holy technology flow throughout the Sector, while the Cult Mechanicus carefully hoards even greater secrets for its own, inscrutable purposes.

124652.name: Warlock: Master of the Arcane
124652.description:
Warlock: Master of the Arcane is a new turned-based strategy game set in the fantastical world of Ardania, popularized in Majesty franchise. Warlock: Master of the Arcane invites players to take on the role of the Great Mage and build a powerful magical empire, giving mighty mages the ability to control armies and wield magic to wage war against another, as they compete with other wizards for the title of Warlock.

Features:


Research and master dozens of spells, conjure strong enchantments and find out powerful spell combinations
Use the forces of three races, along with summons and wild creatures
Innovative city management system with less routine actions
Epic battles with large armies marching across the landscape


Source: The Publisher Website.

124653.name: Hypership Out of Control
124653.description:
Go fast. You cannot stop. Explode when hit asteroid! No fun at all!

Game Features You Will Love:
1 to 4 players!
5 game modes!
Global online leaderboards!
Super retro graphic emulation!
Asteroids as big as your head!
Maniacal laughter that mocks your death!
Floating space eyeballs!

Source: The Developer Website.

124654.name: Nucleus
124654.description:
"Nucleus is a modern take on classic arcade action! Fly the ship around and blow up space debris. Collect powerups and get incredibly cool weapons to cause total particle effect mayhem! The goal of Nucleus is to gather electrons and build atoms. Each level gets progressively cooler and more challenging!"

Source: The Developer Website.

124655.name: Pocket Warriors
124655.description:
"This is a story about two little Warriors in the fantastic world filled with monsters and dragons. Only true Warriors can defeat enemies and win the final victory. Take your weapons and join in the exciting adventure in this action game"

Source: The Developer Website.

124656.name: Pot-in-Egg
124656.description:
"A Rollicking Game of Skill" proclaims the box. And it must have been very skilful, perhaps too skilful.

The game includes 6 wooden egg cups which are placed in the centre of the table. The players have a catapult device with which they lob the egg shaped pieces into an egg cup. At least, that is what they intend to do but it must have been devilishly difficult. The most successful player wins, but I suspect the only player to get it right wins automatically.

124657.name: Mad Science The Card Game
124657.description:
Mad Science The Card Game is a family friendly game played in three phases. Players must first construct a creature from bodies and parts. then they battle the Horrible Experiment created by Dr. Emil Knutberger to save the city. Finally, they fight each other, knocking off parts until only one creation remains standing.

Phase One is purely cards while Phases Two and Three also make use of a D6.

The core set works best with 2 or 3 players. Expansion sets allow for up to 6 players. There is also a Phase Two Solitary version of play.

124658.name: Greek Gods
124658.description:
From Introduction:

The Greek gods. The mere mention of them immediately conjures images of Zeus hurling thunderbolts, Hermes speeding through the lands on winged boots, Aphrodite entrancing men with her beauty, and even Hades ruling the souls in the Underworld. They are the essence of immortality.
